sub_title: Senior Data Engineer at LOGEX Netherlands | MSc in Biomedical Informatics, Applied Machine Learning
summary:
With over eight years of experience in designing and implementing computational and data science projects, I am a Senior Data Engineer/ETL developer at LOGEX Netherlands, a leading provider of data-driven solutions for healthcare. I have a Master of Science degree in Biomedical Informatics from the University of Chicago, where I also studied healthcare analytics at the Booth School of Business.

In my current role, I apply my expert knowledge and skills in biostatistics, machine learning, statistical modelling, predictive analytics, and modular ETL development to create and optimize data pipelines, workflows, and dashboards for clinical and operational data. I am passionate about using data to improve healthcare quality, efficiency, and outcomes, and I enjoy collaborating with multidisciplinary teams of data scientists, engineers, analysts, and domain experts to deliver innovative health tech solutions to our clients.

school.name: The University of Chicago Booth School of Business

awards.title: winner at Health Tech Hackathon in Trauma
awards.description:
TOPIC: developing tools to help trauma patients

Our team proposed and developed a prototype web application as a one stop solution for all resources required by a trauma patient post-discharge. Engagement of victims in a mentor-mentee relationship on a platform and bringing the community and clinical resources on one platform for all-around recovery of such patients.
Solution focussed on anonymity, easy accessibility to resources, ease of navigation through web app, safe engagement of users on the platform.
awards.issuer: University of chicago Medicine Trauma Center

awards.title: Winner - Enova International Data SmackDown Competition
awards.description:
Won the annual Enova International Data Smackdown competition at the University of Chicago.
Secured 3rd prize out of more than 30 teams.
The data challenge involved solving an analytics problem being faced by a leading book publisher. Given a set of publishing training data involving multiple dimensions of authors, books, reviews, and metadata, our team came up with an innovative statistical solution in R, Tableau and Excel to predict the profitability, advertising budget, and 'decision to publish' metrics for a validation data set

projects.title: Consulting Project with University of Chicago Medicine ER Department
projects.description: In this consulting project with ER department of UChicago Medicine to develop relative performance feedback risk adjusted model, which helps healthcare professionals improve their efficacy and reduce patient wait time. It was adjusted for patient workload, order workload, month and day of the week, which gives better insight into the confounding factors which affect the performance of the professionals. This approach was based on multilevel interrupted time series approach. The insight has been how knowledge sharing of good practices among professionals helped in reducing patient wait time in ER department.

contributors.headline: Senior Data Engineer at LOGEX Netherlands | MSc in Biomedical Informatics, Applied Machine Learning

projects.title: A benchmark model for hospitals using composite score from computed risk adjusted metrics
projects.description: Medicare claims data from 29050 patients were used to create a composite score from different risk adjusted metrics like mortality, Length of Stay, AHRQ  Patient Safety Indicators (PSI) . These metrics were given different weightage to generate the composite score.  We used both direct( logistic regression) and indirect standardization to compute risk adjusted metrics.

contributors.headline: Senior Data Engineer at LOGEX Netherlands | MSc in Biomedical Informatics, Applied Machine Learning

projects.title: Django based Microscopic Image gallery and integration of Openseadragon viewer for viewing tissue slides
projects.description: The project involved development of a web application for uploading and converting vendor provided image format to open source image formats and viewing those images in javascript viewer(openseadragon). This was my first web application development project. This project did not involve any new code just integration of different python libraries in the back end of the web application. I found it very interesting to learn the basics of web application development and terminologies assocated with it and also how to manage such projects. The code is available on github.

contributors.headline: Senior Data Engineer at LOGEX Netherlands | MSc in Biomedical Informatics, Applied Machine Learning

projects.title: strategy to improve recruitment and better rentention rates in clinical trials using public health data,digital marketing and social media
projects.description: The project aimed at developing strategy to improve the recruitment  and retention rates in clinical trials in most effective way. The Plan of incorporating digital marketing and public health data to increase the outreach of the information of trials increased the participation rates. How these benefits from digital solutions can help in better design of clinical trials and increase quality of healthcare at clinical trial site was also given emphasis. My role in this project was to analyse the potential financial benefits and how they can be utilised for better care at on site and better management and engagement of participants with each other and clinical trial officials and investigator.
